1.texto: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

2.texto: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.

3.descricao: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
3.texto:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter
Kjeldoran royal mage

regras.texto: This is all one effect. You draw 3 and return 2 cards all in one resolution. Nothing may happen between the two. If something triggers on drawing cards, it will go on the stack after Brainstorm finishes resolving.

4.descricao:
Flying

Cloud Djinn can block only creatures with flying.
4.texto:
As elusive as the footprint of a djinn
—Suq'Ata expression

5.descricao:
Flying

Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
5.texto:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

7.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
7.texto:
"I've seen fog so thick you could cut it, but none that could cut me."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

8.descricao:
Enchant creature

Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
8.texto:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

9.descricao: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
9.texto: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.

10.descricao: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
10.texto:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi

regras.texto: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

11.descricao: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
11.texto: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

12.descricao:
Trample

Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.

Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

regras.texto: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

13.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
13.texto: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

14.descricao: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

regras.texto: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

15.texto: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

16.descricao: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
16.texto: Afterward, Tolaria's winds were like the whispers of lost wizards, calling for life.

regras.texto: It counts how many cards you discard. Since this card will not be in your hand at that time, this card is not counted.

17.texto: Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.

18.descricao:
Flying

{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
18.texto:
"no home no heart no hope"
—Stronghold graffito

19.descricao:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.

Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
19.texto:
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once."
—Kaervek

regras.texto: You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

20.descricao: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
20.texto:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath

22.texto: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home, As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

23.texto: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

24.descricao:
Spend only black mana on X.

Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

regras.texto: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

25.descricao:
Flying

Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
25.texto: "Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light." —Baron Sengir

regras.texto: Can sacrifice itself.

26.texto:
"The nightstalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref."
—Kaervek

27.descricao: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
27.texto: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

regras.texto: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

28.descricao: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
28.texto: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

regras.texto: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

29.descricao:
Flying

Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

regras.texto: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

30.descricao: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.
30.texto:
"This monstrosity will do—for now."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

regras.texto: Triggers when you announce a creature spell, and will resolve before that creature is put onto the battlefield.

31.descricao:
Flying

When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.
31.texto: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.

regras.texto: The triggered ability triggers when the creature spell is cast, and it is put on the stack before any responses can be cast or activated. This ability will resolve before that creature enters the battlefield.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

32.descricao: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
32.texto:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

regras.texto: You can move an Aura onto this card using an untargeted spell or ability without causing this card to be sacrificed.

33.descricao: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

34.descricao: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.

regras.texto: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

35.descricao:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

regras.texto: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

36.descricao: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each turn if able.
36.texto:
"He's big an' dumb an' ready to fight. A lot like ol' Hornhead here."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand,
scouting report

regras.texto: There is no penalty if it can't attack.

37.descricao:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

regras.texto: The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.

If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

38.texto: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

39.descricao: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

40.descricao: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

41.descricao: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

42.texto: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

43.descricao: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
43.texto: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

44.descricao:
Flying

{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
44.texto: While it's true most dragons are cruel, the Shivan dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

45.descricao: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
45.texto:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

46.descricao:
As an additional cost to cast Sonic Burst, discard a card at random.

Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

regras.texto: You can't discard more than once to target more than one creature (or player) or to do multiple amounts of damage to a single creature (or player).
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

47.texto:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

48.descricao: Choose one — Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player; or Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
48.texto:
"Most wizards consider a thunderbolt to be a proper retort."
—Ertai, wizard adept

49.texto: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

50.texto:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

51.texto:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

52.descricao: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
52.texto: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

regras.texto: If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block.
The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

53.descricao: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
53.texto: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.

54.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.

regras.texto: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

55.descricao: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

regras.texto: Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

56.descricao:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

57.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

58.texto:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

59.descricao: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
59.texto: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.

regras.texto: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

60.descricao:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

61.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
61.texto: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

regras.texto: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

62.texto:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

63.descricao: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
63.texto: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.

64.descricao:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

regras.texto: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

65.descricao:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
65.texto:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

66.descricao: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
66.texto: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.

67.descricao: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.
67.texto:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

68.descricao: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
68.texto:
"If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."
—Crovax

69.descricao:
Flying

Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.

At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.

{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

regras.texto: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

70.descricao:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.

At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.

{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

regras.texto: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

71.descricao:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

72.descricao:
Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

73.descricao:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

74.descricao:
Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

75.descricao:
Remote Isle enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

76.descricao:
Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

77.descricao:
Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

78.descricao:
Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.
